name: QRadar
description: This app supports generic, investigative, and ingestion actions on an IBM QRadar device

authorization_token.description: Auth Token for QRadar REST API calls

artifact_max.description: Maximum event artifacts count (excluding the default generated offense artifact)

event_fields_for_query.description: Event fields to include while querying

add_offense_id_to_name.description: Add offense ID to name of containers

events_ingest_start_time.description: Events ingestion initial time relative to offense start time (default is 60 min)

client_auth_cert.description: File name for the client auth cert

client_auth_key.description: File name for the unencrypted client auth key

interval_days.description: Interval days used in all the offenses, events, and flows related actions

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity. This action runs a quick query on the device to check the connection and credentials

actions.verbose: The default start_time is the past 5 days. The default end_time is now. The default count is 100 offenses.

start_time.description: Start of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)

end_time.description: End of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)

offense_id.description: Comma-separated list of offense IDs to fetch

example_values: Fetching all open offenses. Total offenses: 1

actions.description: Get a list of offense closing reasons
Get events belonging to an offense
actions.verbose: Use fields_filter parameter to restrict the events returned that match the filter. For e.g. destinationip='10.10.0.52' and protocolid='6'. For further details refer to the documentation section of the action in the README.

offense_id.description: Offense ID to get events of

start_time.description: Start of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)

end_time.description: End of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)

example_values: Communication with Known Watched Networks	There has been event communication with networks that appear on the systems watch and darknet lists.

actions.description: Get flows that make up an offense for a particular IP
actions.verbose: Use the fields_filter parameter to restrict the flows returned. For e.g. protocolid='6'. For further details refer to the documentation section of the action in the README.

ip.description: IP to get all the flows of

offense_id.description: Offense ID to get flows of

start_time.description: Start of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)

end_time.description: End of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)

fields_filter.description: Filter in AQL format on flow field values

actions.verbose: If the ingest_offense parameter is checked, then, it will ingest the events within the last N days (N - value in the interval_days parameter if given or value in the interval_days parameter in the app config or default 5 days) for the offense mentioned in the offense_id parameter. If the ingest_offense parameter is unchecked, it will fetch only the details of the provided offense ID in the offense_id parameter. The parameter tenant_id is used only when the ingest_offense parameter is checked.

offense_id.description: Offense ID to get the details of

example_values:
Anomaly: Access to Test or Test Defined Address
 preceded by Communication with Known Watched Networks

Anomaly: Access to Test or Test Defined Address
 preceded by Communication with Known Watched Networks

Status: OPEN, Source: 122.122.122.122, Update time: 2019-05-14 10:23:03 UTC, Name: Anomaly: Access to Test or Test Defined Address
 preceded by Communication with Known Watched Networks, Flow count: 0, Start time: 2019-04-04 21:28:47 UTC

actions.verbose:
The general structure of the state file is {"app_version":"app_version", "last_saved_ingest_time":"epoch_time_last_fetched_offense", "last_ingested_events_data":{"offense_id":"epoch_time_last_fetched_event_for_offense_id"}}.
  • There is no validation for values provided in the offense_id action parameter because this action does not make any API calls to the QRadar instance and it merely provides a way of manipulating the state file. It is requested to please confirm if the offense ID being provided as an input exists on the QRadar instance. Any wrong value provided in the offense_id parameter may corrupt the state file and the functionalities dependent on it.
  • No comma-separated values should be provided in any of the action input parameters or else it may corrupt the state file and the functionalities dependent on it.
  • The set last saved offense ingest time operation sets the epoch time of the provided value in the datetime parameter against the last_saved_ingest_time key in the state file.
  • The set last saved events ingest time operation sets the epoch time of the provided value in the datetime parameter against the key corresponding to the offense ID value provided in the offense_id in the dictionary structure against the key last_ingested_events_data in the state file. The format for the date string should match the formats 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.Z', 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.Z', 'YYYY-MM-DD', or 'HH:MM:SS.Z'. Users can provide only date (time will be 00:00:00.000000) or only time (current date will be considered by default). The action considers that the provided value in the datestring parameter represents the date string in the timezone selected in the asset configuration parameter timezone and accordingly stores the epoch time into the state file.
  • The delete last saved ingestion time data operation deletes the entire last saved ingestion time data stored in the state file.
  • The get last saved ingestion time data operation fetches the entire last saved ingestion time data stored in the state file.
  • The parameter offense_id does not support comma-separated values. The user has to provide a single non-zero positive integer value of the corresponding Offense ID.
  • The parameter offense_id is mandatory for the operation set last saved events ingest time.

operation.description: Operation to perform on the ingestion data stored in the state file
value_list: get last saved ingestion time data
delete last saved ingestion time data
set last saved offense ingest time
set last saved events ingest time
operation.default: get last saved ingestion time data

datetime.description: Datetime string to be stored against the ingestion data in the state file

offense_id.description: Offense ID against which to store the 'datetime' parameter value

example_values: get last saved ingestion time data
delete last saved ingestion time data
set last saved offense ingest time
set last saved events ingest time
Offense ID_1=Fri Nov 29 10:05:25 2019 UTC +0000, Offense ID_3=Fri Nov 29 10:01:24 2019 UTC +0000, Offense ID_2=Fri Nov 29 10:03:18 2019 UTC +0000
Offense ID_1=Fri Nov 29 10:05:25 2019 UTC +0000, Offense ID_3=Fri Nov 29 10:01:24 2019 UTC +0000, Offense ID_2=Fri Nov 29 10:03:18 2019 UTC +0000

Last saved offense ingest time: Mon Dec 09 11:11:11 2019 UTC +0000, Last ingested events ingest time: Offense ID_1=Fri Nov 29 10:05:25 2019 UTC +0000, Offense ID_3=Fri Nov 29 10:01:24 2019 UTC +0000, Offense ID_2=Fri Nov 29 10:03:18 2019 UTC +0000

actions.description: Execute an ariel query on the QRadar device
actions.verbose:
Use this action to execute queries using AQL on the QRadar device. AQL is a well documented (on the IBM website) query language with quite a few built-in functions.
Do note that this action could have a dynamic set of values returned in the data array since the query can specify the columns to return. This is the main reason for not listing the data paths.

example_values: select qid from events where sourceip='10.1.16.50'
select qid category, destinationip, destinationport, eventcount, identityip, logsourceid, magnitude, protocolid, sourceip, sourceport, starttime, username from events where sourceip='10.1.16.50'

actions.description: Add an item to a reference set in Qradar

reference_set_name.description: Name of reference set to add to

reference_set_value.description: Value to add to the reference set

example_values: Element type: IP, Name: Demo, Number of elements: 3
Element type: IP, Name: Asset Reconciliation IPv4 Whitelist, Number of elements: 1
